page.title: 08INDUSTRY WROUGHT FURNITURE
page.content: {FREEGATE MILL This mill is in Ickornshaw,a small hamlet off the main road. They use aluminium to make garden furniture.Some of the aluminium is from scrap and some is bought as new. It comes from Jamaica and America.It is melted in a furnace which is at 700 degrees.It is then ladled out into moulds made of sand,then allowed to cool.The workers have to wear goggles to protect their eyes from the heat and the sparks.The furniture is painted using static electricity,which works like a magnet spray.The colours are mainly white and black.The chairs and tables are then placed in an oven so that the paint sets hard,it takes about 20 minutes.The mill used to be a cotton mill.The pattern for the wrought furniture comes from Ironbridge.
